snippet: ESPN filed suit last April after Verizon moved some channels off Fios’s basic cable offering and separated them into tiers customers could choose from.
abstract: ESPN and Verizon settle lawsuit brought by sports network after cable provider elected to offer it as standalone subscription over its FiOS service; debate reflects controversy over industry's move towards offering consumers multiple packages at range of price points.
lead_paragraph: ESPN filed suit last April after Verizon moved some channels off Fios’s basic cable offering and separated them into tiers customers could choose from.

headline.main: ESPN and Verizon Settle Lawsuit Over Cable Package
headline.print_headline: ESPN Settles Suit Over Bundling by Verizon
